<img src="img/arctic.png" alt="Alaskan Arctic" style="float: right; width: 200px;"/>


The time series plot and data summary below present statistics on sea ice extent within Alaskan Arctic Sea
computed from the remote sensing data from NOAA/NSIDC on PolarWatch:

* Mean (1985-2015): Represents the average sea ice extent from 1985 to 2015.
* Upper and Lower Bounds of Error Band (1985-2015): Reflect the uncertainty of the Mean (1985 to 2015).
* Current and Previous Year: Show the monthly sea ice extent values for the current and previous year within the area.

The Alaska region is made up of distinct large marine ecosystems across: the Gulf of Alaska (GOA), Aleutian Islands (AI), eastern Bering Sea (EBS), northern Bering Sea, and Chukchi Sea and Beaufort Seas (referred to here as the Alaskan Arctic). Fishery management areas include the Gulf of Alaska and Bering Sea/Aleutian Islands. No federal fisheries currently occur in the Alaskan Arctic.

More information about the data and sea ice extent calculation can be found on [Sea Ice Extent page](extent.html).

## Sea ice extent monthly time series
```{r}
#| echo: false

    var_orders = c(as.character(lastyear+1), as.character(lastyear),"Mean (1985-2015)", "1985-2022")
    plot_colors = c("#318CE7", "#F08080", "#94C973", "#cccccc", "#cccccc", "#cccccc")
```

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false


# Plot
# https://plotly.com/r/hover-text-and-formatting/
# https://plotly.com/r/time-series/

library(plotly)
library(magrittr)

baseline_df1 = read.csv("data/bs_AlaskanArctic.csv")
recent_df1 = read.csv("data/ext_recent_AlaskanArctic.csv")

# Get upper and lower bound of sea ice extent using standard dev
baseline_df1$upper_extent <- baseline_df1$seaice_extent_mean + baseline_df1$seaice_extent_std
baseline_df1$lower_extent <- ifelse(baseline_df1$seaice_extent_mean - baseline_df1$seaice_extent_std >= 0, baseline_df1$seaice_extent_mean - baseline_df1$seaice_extent_std, 0)


fig <- plot_ly(baseline_df1, x = ~date, y = ~upper_extent, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',line = list(color = 'transparent'),showlegend = FALSE, name = 'Upper bound') 
fig <- fig %>% add_trace(y = ~lower_extent, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',
            fill = 'tonexty', fillcolor='rgba(0,100,80,0.2)', line = list(color = 'transparent'),
          showlegend = FALSE, name = 'Lower bound') 
fig <- fig %>% add_trace(x = ~date, y = ~seaice_extent_mean, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',
            line = list(color=plot_colors[3], width  = 2),name = 'Baseline')    

# Last year
dat_last = recent_df1[grep(paste0("^", lastyear), recent_df1$time), ]
dat_this = recent_df1[grep(paste0("^", lastyear+1), recent_df1$time), ]

dat_last$time <- format(as.Date(dat_last$time), "%m-%d")
dat_this$time <- format(as.Date(dat_this$time), "%m-%d")

fig <- fig %>% add_trace(data = dat_this, x = ~time, y = ~seaice_extent, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',
            line = list(color=plot_colors[1], width  = 2),name = lastyear + 1) 



fig <- fig %>% add_trace(data = dat_last, x = ~time, y = ~seaice_extent, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',
            line = list(
            color = plot_colors[2], width = 2), name = lastyear) 


fig <- fig %>% layout(title = "Sea ice extent time series", hovermode = "x unified", showlegend=TRUE,
         xaxis = list(title = "Dates"),
         yaxis = list (title = "Million square km"))
fig




```
